abstract: Thursday’s crossover stunt linking popular crime procedurals “CSI” and “Without a Trace” proved to be a ratings windfall for CBS. According to Nielsen’s estimates, 21.9 million viewers tuned in to “CSI” at 9 p.m., the show’s largest audience since its September premiere. Likewise, following it, “Without a Trace” (21.4 million) delivered CBS’s best ratings in the 10 p.m. time slot in almost two years.
lead_paragraph: Thursday’s crossover stunt linking popular crime procedurals “CSI” and “Without a Trace” proved to be a ratings windfall for CBS. According to Nielsen’s estimates, 21.9 million viewers tuned in to “CSI” at 9 p.m., the show’s largest audience since its September premiere. Likewise, following it, “Without a Trace” (21.4 million) delivered CBS’s best ratings in the 10 p.m. time slot in almost two years.

headline.main: Ratings: CBS Crossover A Crossover Hit
